y, Labour and the Post-partum Period
/circle6 Foetal surface
/lozenge6 Hold the umbilical cord in one hand and let the placenta and membranes hang 
down like an inverted umbrella.
/lozenge6 Th  e umbilical vessels will be seen passing from the cord and gradually fading into 
the edge of the placenta.
/lozenge6 Look for free-ending vessels and holes which may indicate that a lobule has been 
left  behind in the uterus.
/lozenge6 Look for the insertion of the cord, particularly the velamentous ins
